    		Give to Chico State
    	Gifts to Chico State allow us to invest in the students and the university. A donation to Chico State is a partnership, giving deans and faculty immediate funding to create innovative curricula and real-world experiences that prepare students for meaningful careers.
                        Give Now
                    
                        Ways to Give
                    
                        Impact of Your Gift
                    
                        Giving Programs
                    
                        Stay Connected
                    
                        Crowdfunding Projects
                    Why GiveBy donating to Chico State, you are ensuring that gaps in state funding won’t hinder our ability to provide state-of-the-art learning and a meaningful Chico State experience for current and future Wildcats."I had the privilege and the honor of receiving the [Lt. Robert Merton] Rawlins Award, the most prestigious award at Chico State. It was very exciting for me, and I feel very honored. It’s a great step for our program and also for myself—being able to get out of college debt-free. That was one of my goals. And from a professional aspect, I’ve gotten so much recognition. It’s been amazing getting to network with other people just solely on this award."—Yanetli Navarro-Hernandez (Senior, Concrete Industry Management)
            See more impacts of giving.
        University AdvancementVice President Ahmad BouraKendall Hall, Room 114530-898-3590www.csuchico.edu/advancementSupport Chico StateDepartmentsAdvancement ServicesAlumni & Parent EngagementUniversity CommunicationsUniversity DevelopmentUniversity Public EngagementChico Performances(opens in new window)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
